PROJECT PREPARATORY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE 
 
A.   Justification 
 
1.  Currently the feasibility study is being conducted by the local design institute. The PPTA 
will  assist  to  improve  the  feasibility  study  and  produce  mutually  agreed  design  and 
implementation arrangements suitable for ADB financing, including pre-implementation works 
for the project. The government and UTY were advised that approval of the PPTA does not 
commit ADB to financing any ensuing project.

C.   Cost Estimate and Proposed Financing Arrangement 
 
3.  The total cost of the TA amounts to $445,000, of which $400,000 will be financed on a 
grant basis by ADB's Technical Assistance Special Fund (TASF-V). 6 The Government through 
UTY  will  provide  counterpart  support  in  the  form  of  PIU  staff,  office  space  and  supplies, 
secretarial assistance, and other in-kind contributions. The value of the government contribution 
is estimated to account for 10% of the total TA cost. The detailed cost estimate is in Table A3.2. 
 
 
 
                                                
6  Project preparatory technical assistance will be financed from proceeds of the earlier approved TA 8706 for 
Uzbekistan: CAREC Corridors 2 and 3 (Marakand-Bukhara) Railway Electrification Project, subject to approval of a 
major change in scope.

D.   Consulting Services 
 
4.  The required positions and person-months are indicated in Table A3.3. The PPTA will 
require 13 person-months (PMs) international specialists and 14 PMs of national experts to be 
recruited individually. For project due diligence where feasibility study is under preparation by 
EA following government internal requirements, hiring individual consultants with short duration 
is more appropriate for quick mobilization of consulting service and cost-effective than firms to 
perform the assignment. The individual experts will be engaged by ADB in accordance with the 
Guidelines on the Use of Consultants (2013, as amended from time to time).

5.  The outline terms of reference for the project preparatory TA consultants are described 
in the paras. below.

10  Appendix 3 
6.  Railway Electric Engineering Specialist (International, 2 PMs). Undertake, but will 
not be limited to, the following tasks: Working closely with other consultants, UTY and ADB (i) 
review  and  consolidate  technical  due  diligence  of  the  project  including  overall  scope, 
engineering,  cost  estimate,  and  other  relevant  areas;  and  (ii)  assist  in  the  preparation  of 
procurement design and bidding documents for the ensuing project, especially in relation to 
overhead catenary system, traction substations and dispatcher points, external power supply, 
maintenance machinery and depot equipment, and SCADA. Qualification: Bachelor’s degree 
with professional work experience of preferably 10 years or more in railway electric engineering; 
Working experience or knowledge of ADB’s operations will be desirable; Must have proven 
analytical  skills  and  working  experience  in  ADB  developing  member  countries;  Uzbekistan 
project experience would be preferred. 
 
7.  Railway  Signaling  and  Communications  Specialist  (International,  2  PMs). 
Undertake, but will not be limited to, the following tasks: Work closely together with the Railway 
Electric Engineering Specialist and Procurement and Contract Specialist, and assist in the 
preparation of procurement design and bidding documents for the ensuing project, especially in 
relation  to  signaling  and  communication  systems.  Qualification:  Bachelor’s  degree  with 
professional  work  experience  of  preferably  10  years  or  more  in  railway  signaling  and 
communications; Working experience or knowledge of ADB’s operations will be desirable; Must 
have proven analytical skills and working experience in ADB developing member countries; 
Uzbekistan project experience would be preferred. 
 
8.  Railway Engineer (National, 3 PMs) Assist international consultants in gathering in-
depth information and preparing project documents. More specifically, the expert will undertake 
but will not be limited to the following tasks: (i) provide overall coordination and all necessary 
assistance to all international experts and consolidate their outputs in accordance with the 
Uzbekistan government requirements; (ii) review preliminary designs including safety aspects 
during construction and operation, and rail line maintenance; (iii) update the cost estimates; (iv) 
assist international transport economist with the demand forecasts for the proposed railway; and 
(v) prepare an implementation schedule. Qualification: Bachelor’s degree in railway engineering 
specialization; familiar with Uzbekistan railway practices and five or more years’ railway project 
experience; preferably good skill in written and spoken English; ADB project experience is an 
added advantage. 
 
9.  Procurement and Contract Specialist (International, 2 PMs) Support UTY and ADB 
to (i) undertake procurement activities including EA’s procurement capacity assessment in line 
with  ADB’s  Procurement  Guidelines  (2013,  as  updated)  and  Guidelines  on  the  use  of 
Consultants (2013, as updated); (ii) receiving inputs from the Railway Electric Engineering 
Specialist and Railway Signaling and Communications Specialist, prepare bidding documents 
and request for proposals documents; (iii) receive, open, and assist EA in the procedures for 
obtaining  ADB  no-objection  on  evaluation  of  proposals,  finalization  of  contracts,  and  the 
processes for contractor mobilization; and (iv) train EA staff on ADB procurement requirements 
and on Plant contract management. Qualification: relevant Bachelor's degree with preferably 10 
or more years’ work experience in international bidding and procurement; excellent analytical 
skills and working experience in ADB developing member countries; prior experience of ADB 
projects in Uzbekistan is a preference. 
 
10.  Transport Economist (International, 1.5 PMs) Undertake, but not be limited to, the 
following  tasks:  (i)  gather  in-depth  information  to  update  the  traffic  forecast;  (ii)  review 
macroeconomic and sector contexts, conduct demand analysis, identify project rationale and 
alternatives;  (iii)  identify  and  compare  project  costs  and  benefits  (including  additional

Appendix 3  11 
environmental benefits from electrification), assess project sustainability, conduct sensitivity and 
risk  analysis,  and  identify  indicators  for  project  performance  monitoring  system;  and  (iv) 
coordinate with other experts in order to produce a cohesive joint report for processing the 
project for ADB financing. Qualification: Bachelor’s degree in economics or equivalent with 
broad-based work experience (a minimum of 10 years of relevant professional experience) 
recognized as an expert in transport economics; proven analytical skills and working experience 
in ADB developing member countries; Uzbekistan experience would be preferred. 
 
11.  Financial  Specialist  (International,  2  PMs)  Undertake,  but  not  be  limited  to,  the 
following tasks: (i) support the preparation of detailed budget and financing plan for the project; 
(ii) carry out the financial evaluation of the project and determine financial internal rate of return 
and weighted average cost of capital computations and evaluate the financial viability of the 
investment;  (iii)  prepare  an  updated  financial  management  assessment  pertaining  to  UTY, 
including through a study of their financial statements; (iv) identify key risks and carry out 
sensitivity analysis; and (v) conduct financial analysis and identify actions to ensure project 
sustainability and propose related assurances or covenants. Qualification: Bachelor’s degree 
and a broad-based work experience (10 years of relevant professional experience) recognized 
as an expert in transport financial analysis; proven analytical skills and working experience in 
ADB developing member countries, with a recognized accountancy qualification such as a 
Chartered  Accountant,  Certified  Public  Accountant  or  Chartered  Certified  Accountant; 
Uzbekistan experience would be preferred. 
 
12.  Environmental Specialist (International, 1 PM; National, 3 PMs). Work as a team to 
undertake but will not be limited to the following works:  
•  Prepare  a  Rapid  Environmental  Assessment  (REA)  checklist  to  confirm  the 
 
environmental classification of the proposed project. 
•  Prepare  Initial  Environmental  Examination  (IEE)  Report  including  a  fully  costed 
Environmental  Management  Plan  (EMP),for  the  railway  alignment  and  associated 
facilities. .The IEE report should be prepared in accordance to the ADB’s Safeguard 
Policy Statement 2009  
•  The EMP should include environmental mitigation measures, a monitoring program, 
capacity  building  measures  and  institutional  arrangements  for  EMP  implementation, 
based  on  assessment  of  the  capacity  of  the  Government  and  UTY  in  addressing 
environmental problems. If the existing facilities will be rehabilitated or reconstructed as 
part of the Project, undertake environmental audit to check whether the existing facilities, 
including the alignment and associated facilities, are in compliance with the Government 
environmental requirement, and  with ADB’s environmental safeguards requirement. If 
discrepancies or incompliance will be identified, corrective actions should be proposed 
for each area of concern, including costs and schedule before and during the project 
implementation. The Environmental Compliance Audit Report could be attached as an 
appendix of the IEE. 
•  Assist UTY in conducting public consultation as required by SPS 2009, in obtaining 
necessary Government approval and permits to the IEE and for commencing the project 
activities. 
 
13.  Qualification: For International consultant relevant education background to undertake 
environmental impact assessment works and significant experience for preparing environmental 
impact assessment for similar projects, and be familiar with implementation of Uzbekistan’s 
environmental protection law; preferably a master degree and at least 5 years’ experience in 
work related with environmental impact assessment. Familiarity with the ADB Safeguards Policy

12  Appendix 3 
Statement (SPS) 2009 is an advantage. For national consultant relevant education background 
for  data  collection  to  prepare  environmental  impact  assessment  and  some  experience  on 
preparing environmental impact assessment of project in Uzbekistan, and well knowledge of 
Uzbekistan’s environmental law and regulation; preferably undergraduate degree with at least 3 
years’ experience. 
 
14.  Resettlement Specialist (International, 2 PM; National, 3 PMs).  Work as a team to 
undertake but will not be limited to the following work: 
 
•  Reconfirm the project classification for Involuntary Resettlement (IR) and Indigenous 
Peoples Safeguards. 
•  Prepare options to minimize land acquisition and associated impacts. 
•  Prepare a Resettlement Framework which would crucially include an entitlement matrix, 
to guide the development of a Resettlement Plan (RP): and 
•  Once detailed design is available, assist UTY to prepare a Resettlement Plan (RP) 
based on a census and assets inventory of the project affected persons that sets out 
strategies to mitigate adverse impacts and maintain living standards of affected people. 
It shall address the policy objectives of ADB and the government for land acquisition and 
resettlement,  in  line  with  the  ADB  SPS  2009  and  relevant  Government  Law  and 
Regulations. 
•  Conduct 100% census and assets inventory of the project affected persons based on a 
detailed measurement survey, a survey of their socio economic conditions, and carry out 
meaningful consultations with the affected persons. 
•  Describe the institutional arrangements for addressing social impacts/risks associated 
with the project, to develop grievance redress mechanism, and to develop effective 
arrangement to implement the RP. 
•  Prepare an estimated budget as part of the RP for implementing RP covering all aspects. 
 
15.  Qualification: For International Consultant relevant education background and significant 
experience in preparing RP and implementing land acquisition and resettlement in Central Asia 
especially for projects in Uzbekistan; full understanding of the ADB SPS 2009; preferably a  
master  degree  and  over  7  years’  experience  and  at  least  3  years’  work  as  resettlement 
specialist. Russian language skills are desirable. For national consultant relevant education 
background  to  undertake  survey  and  consultations,  and  market  price  data  generation  for 
compensation of lost assets as part of RP preparation, and some experience in preparing RP 
with  full  understanding  on  Uzbekistan  law  and  regulation  on  land  acquisition;  preferably 
undergraduate  degree from  land management institute  with  at  least  3  years’  related  work 
experience. 
 
16.  Social Development Specialist (National, 3 PMs) Undertake but will not be limited to: 
•  Conduct socio economic surveys to prepare the Poverty and Social Analysis (PSA). 
•  Conduct  the  PSA,  including,  gender  assessment,  participatory  assessment,  labor 
impacts and other social impacts as described in ADB’s  Handbook on Poverty and 
Social Analysis: A Working Document (December 2012), and Operations Manual C1-
Poverty Reduction (14 July 2004), C2-Gender and Development (6 December 2010), 
and C3-Incorporation of Social Dimensions into ADB Operations (6 December 2010).  
•  Propose gender classification for the project and prepare measures to comply with such 
classification.  
•  Prepare a social and gender action plan.

Appendix 3  13 
•  Prepare a summary poverty reduction and social strategy including gender strategy 
and/or measures as appropriate. 
 
17.  Qualification: relevant education background to conduct social impact assessment and 
significant experience in preparing poverty and social impact assessment. Familiar with ADB’s 
policy on social impacts especially gender and poverty. Preferably master degree with at least 5 
years’ related work experience. 
 
18.  Resource Persons (international and national consultants, up to 10 person-day 
each). Resource persons on railway signal and telecommunication, power supply, supervisory 
control and data acquisition system, electric locomotive workshop, institution development, etc. 
may be engaged during project preparation. They will provide specialized expertise to UTY as 
regards (i) recent technology development in railway electrification, operation and maintenance; 
(ii) improving the technical and cost side of UTY's feasibility study as needed; and (iii) other 
railway technical and institutional aspects as appropriate. 
 
E.   Implementation Arrangements 
 
19.  The  EA for the TA  is UTY. TA funds  will  be  disbursed  in  accordance  with  ADB’s 
Technical Assistance Disbursement Handbook (2010, as amended from time to time). On a 
regular basis, the consultant will work closely with UTY and the local design institute and 
provide all necessary assistance in the preparation of project documents. The consultants will 
report directly to the project officer unless delegated to UTY. The consultants will submit to UTY 
and ADB (i) an inception report 1 week after commencement of services; (ii) an interim report 
after one month; and (iii) a final report (including a five-page executive summary with key 
findings and recommendations) 3 weeks after receipt of review comments from UTY and ADB. 
All reports will be written in English and translated into Russian. Two hard copies and one soft 
copy of the inception, interim, and draft final reports (in English) will be submitted to ADB. Three 
hard copies and one soft copy of each report (in both Russian and English) will be submitted to 
UTY. The proposed TA processing and implementation schedule is listed in Table A3.4.
